column4: I've been avoiding 64-bit distros for years due to reports of instability, lack of ported apps etc... and today I'm wondering if thats still a valid reason? should I be running a 64-bit linux? what are the advantages?
the only advantage is you can use more than 3.5 gb of ram
I think I might, I just feel like I'm missing out on something.. .but it seems like that something might just be "problems"
